heading: Micro-Econometrics
text:
microeconometric models, variables interest often feature restricted distributions—instance discontinuous support—, necessitates specific models. Typical examples discrete-choice models (binary, multinomial, ordered outcomes), sample selection models (censored truncated outcomes), count-data models (integer outcomes). course describes estimation interpretation models. also shows discrete-choice models can emerge (structural) random-utility frameworks.course developed Jean-Paul Renne. illustrated R codes using various packages can obtained CRAN.
